dt.t: He looks hip and relaxed in jeans and a floppy salt-and-pepper sweater, a soul patch beneath his lower lip, his hair cropped short and stylishly {wi}nappy{/wi}.

A Nova Scotia court martial heard contrasting views from witnesses Monday on whether a white reservist's use of the word "{wi}nappy{/wi}" to describe a black co-worker's hair was intended as a racial slur.

In "Nappy Hair," the 51-year-old Herron, who is black, tells how her uncle taught her to celebrate her hair—and her culture. The controversy caught her by surprise, since Herron does not regard the word "{wi}nappy{/wi}," or frizzy, as negative.

dt: {bc}having a hairy, fuzzy, or downy surface

dt.t: Press velvets, velours, corduroy, or other {wi}nappy{/wi} fabrics on the wrong side; don't let the iron rest on the fabric.
